article.headline: Loyola 96, Niagara 95
article.story: BALTIMORE (AP) -- Gerald Brown made a 3-point shot with 20 seconds left to lift the Loyola Greyhounds to a 96-95 overtime win over Niagara University on Friday. Brown scored 28 points to lead the Greyhounds (9-6, 5-1 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference), and Marquis Sullivan added 18 points. The Purple Eagles (8-9, 3-3) had a chance to win the game with one second left, but Clif Brown's shot fell short as time expired. Niagara's Tyrone Lewis forced overtime after he was able to grab an offensive rebound and score when Lorenzo Miles missed two free throws. In overtime, Lewis scored eight points, including a pair of 3-pointers. His second 3-pointer gave Niagara a 95-93 lead with 47 seconds remaining. Charron Fisher had a career-high tying 28 points while J.R. Duffey added a season-high 20 points and a team-high seven rebounds.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
